docblock.description: Deals with GET Articles API from helpscout.
GuzzleHttp\Client
HelpscoutApi\Contracts\ApiKey;
Get all articles from a category and return as JSON.
docblock.long-description:
Uses the category to get the article information.
You can pass in an optional ArticleParams object in which you set the order in which the articles are sorted by.

docblock.description: Get all articles from a collection and return as JSON.
docblock.long-description:
Uses the collection to get the article information.
You can pass in an optional ArticleParams object in which you set the order in which the articles are sorted by.

docblock.description: Create a Collection Get Request.
docblock.long-description: This works the same was as a `getAllFromCollection` function, instead of returning a JSON repersentation, we return a Request object that you would then use the the Pool class.

docblock.description: Get an article and return as JSON.
docblock.long-description:
Gets the article based on the article information, such as id.
Optional param is draft, which gets back or allows you to get back a draft article.

docblock.description: Simmilar to getSingle, returns a request object instead.
Uses sendAsync to send a psr7 request.
Get all related articles for a specific article
docblock.long-description:
Gets all related articles based on the article information, such as id.
We also allow you to pass in an optional ArticleParams which allows you to set the params of the url to be passed in.

docblock.description: Search the articles based on an article query
docblock.long-description: The article query is a string which is built from seting values and then using the `getQuery` to get the query for the endpoint.

docblock.description: Get all article revisions
docblock.long-description: You can pass in an optinal param called page which sets the page of revisions to get back.

docblock.description: Get an article revision

docblock.description: Deals with GET Redirects API from helpscout.
GuzzleHttp\Client
HelpscoutApi\Contracts\ApiKey;
Get all redirects based on a site.
Get a single redirect based on redirect id
Find a redirect based on a url and a site.
docblock.long-description:
The url is the url in which will resolve the redirect.
The response url could be null if the given url does not redirect anyway.
The url can be: `/old/path/123` for example, which, if it has a redirect will return the redirected path.

docblock.description: Used for creating and resolving pools of requests.
We pool all the requests using Guzzels Pool and wait for them all to complete.
docblock.long-description:
This will create a set of promises that we wait on for completion before doing the next set which is set by the `RequestPool` `getConcurreny()` function.
The `$successCallbackFunction` is optional, as you may not want to do anything on success, how ever the rejected is not. Guzzel doesn't log errors or store them for us, so it's important that we log them our selves.
For the success, we pass in the response object to which you can do with as you please. This response objecty will be a `GuzzleHttp\Psr7\Response` object.
For the rejected we pass in the reason and the index, the index corelates to the index in the array of requests passed in.

docblock.description: Allows you to post an article to Helpscout using the API.
GuzzleHttp\Client
HelpscoutApi\Contracts\ApiKey;
Post an article to the Helpscout API.
Create the article in an asynchronous way.
docblock.long-description:
Same method signature and options as `create`.
This is great for when you need to create a set of articles that do not got over the rate limit.

docblock.description: Returns a new request object
docblock.long-description: This is good for creating pools of requests. This is when you don't know how many requests you need to create and thus might go over the rate limit.

docblock.long-description: The maximum is 100.
